etymology.description: pictogram: two entangled ropes; original form of 糾
etymology.interpretation: Depicts two ropes twisting together, directly expressing the idea of entangling or joining. Later script forms standardized this meaning in 糾 (now simplified as 纠), while 丩 preserves an archaic pictorial shape reminiscent of a twist.

examples.chinese: 两条绳子丩成一股(兩條繩子丩成一股)。
examples.pinyin: Liǎng tiáo shéngzi jiū chéng yī gǔ.
examples.english: Two ropes twist into a single strand.

examples.chinese: 藤蔓丩住树干(藤蔓丩住樹幹)。
把两端丩在一起(把兩端丩在一起)。
examples.pinyin: Bǎ liǎng duān jiū zài yīqǐ.
